intro: Octarrhena semiorbicularis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Octarrhena semiorbicularis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a valuable plant for stabilizing sandy or gravelly areas.
